content: Spending your weekend outdoors? Keep your eyes out for the Orionids meteor shower!A few Orionids could be viewable late Saturday and Sunday nights into the predawn. Even if they don't show, it may still be a good time for moonwatching. Get the details: https://t.co/1rbZ2GPqL3 https://t.co/71kx7Gmj0X

Our next launch to the @Space_Station is sending up studies to protect against space radiation, test cold welding in low Earth orbit, and understand the solar wind.Learn more about the latest @ISS_Research: https://t.co/uYQlsYEUc7 https://t.co/oGdoID0j2a

There are at least 12 things to look forward to next year: the stunning science images included in our 2025 Science Calendar.Download a free copy – and get some wallpapers for your computer and phone, too! https://t.co/w2AFwaO73j https://t.co/YT8iIoTZFc

Behold: a full moon worthy of the Halloween season. The Hunter’s Moon!According to the Farmer’s Almanac, this month’s full moon coincides with deer hunting season. Keep an eye on the sky for the next couple days, as the Moon will appear full through Friday morning. https://t.co/6CfDPDYFBB

LIVE: NASA and @NOAA experts share the latest @NASASun updates on Solar Cycle 25, including the forecast as we approach solar maximum. Will there be more auroras in store? Listen in: https://t.co/4WN8kIIMCK https://t.co/5XpL5rQdWX

In praise of mystery ✨After a successful launch aboard a @SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket from @NASAKennedy, @EuropaClipper is on its way from our ocean world to another to see if Jupiter's moon Europa has conditions suitable for life: https://t.co/nfI8RjiAuQ https://t.co/rLJdUg7VHk
